ISSUE.TITLE: IPA Binary Analysis issue when archiving Distribution and Development Provisiong profile it throws unrelated error
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: > We have a partial fix for this is 3.1.1. I don't think we can fix this completely as from binary analysis, it's difficult to get into a precise conclusion. @ajinabraham I tried to re-investigate this issue it seems there something wrong while compiling the binary to development/distribution profile since it has symbols stripped. It could be 100% false positive for both _(SSP & ARC) and Insecure Apis error_ Hence it throws an unrelated error: **Archiving to Distribution Profile** - _No insecure apis error etc_, **But it throws (SSP and ARC) error** **Archiving to Development Profile** - _No error for (SSP and ARC)_, **But it throws insecure apis error etc** This is tested with the latest Swift 5.2.x Ref: you quoted last time which is related on this issue. https://github.com/MobSF/Mobile-Security-Framework-MobSF/issues/681#issuecomment-412803911 _Originally posted by @delmarz in https://github.com/MobSF/Mobile-Security-Framework-MobSF/issues/372#issuecomment-674363738_

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Multiple Feature Improvements around Binary Analysis and NIAP support (#1558) * NIAP Analysis for Android based on https://www.niap-ccevs.org/MMO/PP/394.R/pp_app_v1.2_table-reqs.htm * Improved Android Code Analysis Rules * Code QA * Android App Compare QA * Improved Android SO binary analysis. (Thanks to https://lief.quarkslab.com/ and https://gist.github.com/apogiatzis/fb617cd118a9882749b5cb167dae0c5d) * Android Strings now includes strings from shared objects. * URLs and emails are now extracted from shared objects as well. * Refactor iOS Binary Analysis with LIEF (Thanks to https://gist.github.com/ChiChou/15f0772db25343be0bb7072f15992a4e) * Fixes Bugs #621, #1242 #1516 * Remove Otool Requirements and jtool2
